Guide to the Records of the Center for Haitian Studies

author.value: Finding aid prepared by Emilyn L. Brown, August 2004, and edited by Nancy Cricco, March 2009. Inventory updated by Katie Ehrlich and Stephanie Schmeling, September 2010.

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit
                <date>2013-03-04T11:39-0500</date>

unittitle.value: Records of the Center for Haitian Studies

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value:
The initial proposal for the Center for Haitian Studies took place at the 
                <title render="italic">Conference on Resources and Research in Hait</title>i, held in New York City, November 1-4, 1967. During its relatively brief existence, the Center helped focus attention on critical issues in Haiti under the Duvalier government and provided research and training opportunities for Haitians living abroad or in exile. The bilingual collection includes correspondence, financial records, reports, minutes, statutes, press releases, clippings, draft material, published conference proceedings, transcripts, articles, printed matter, audiotapes, notes, and ephemera.

p.value:
Additionally, please note that this collection is stored 
                <extref ns2:href="http://www.nyu.edu/library/bobst/research/arch/haiti.htm">
                    <archref> offsite </archref> </extref>, and you must contact the repository to schedule access.

Published citations should take the following form:
                <lb/>
                <lb/>Identification of item, date (if known); The Records of the Center for Haitian Studies; RISM RG 11; box number; folder number;
                <lb/>
                <address>
                    <addressline>Research Institute for the Study of Man/New York University Archives</addressline>
                </address>

<list>
                    <item>Final Report to the Ford Foundation, 1968 (Series II, folder 7)</item>
                    <item> "Center for Haitian Studies Established," press release, June 10, 1968 (Series III, folder 3)</item>
                    <item>"Haiti Research Group Planned," 
                        <title render="italic">Miami Herald</title>, November 11, 1967 </item>
                </list>

A copy of the published conference proceedings, 
                <title render="italic">Haitian Potential: Research and Resources of Haiti </title>(Vera Rubin and Richard P. Schaedel, eds.) has been appended to the collection.

dsc.value:
Series I. Correspondence, 1967-1972, undated Scope and Contents note

.5 linear feet (1 box), arranged chronologically. This series consists of incoming and outgoing letters, budget material, book lists, greeting cards, notes and ephemera. The letters detail the formation, accomplishments and demise of the Center for Haitian Studies (CHS).

 Correspondence 1 1 1967 January-August Correspondence 1 2 1967 September-October Correspondence 1 3 1967 November-December Correspondence 1 4 1968 January-March Correspondence 1 5 1968 April-June Correspondence 1 6 1968 July-October Correspondence 1 7 1968 November-December Correspondence 1 8 1969 January-March Correspondence 1 9 1969 April-June Correspondence 1 10 1969 July-August Correspondence 1 11 1969 September-December Correspondence 1 12 1970 January-February Correspondence 1 13 1970 March-September Correspondence 1 14 1971 February-May Correspondence 1 15 1971 June-November, undated Correspondence 1 16 1972 January-December, undated Series II. Ford Foundation Grant Papers, 1967 - 1971, undated General note

Materials in Series II are at the Reed Foundation.

 Scope and Contents note

.5 linear feet (1 box), arranged chronologically. The papers in this series relate to conference funding and include expense sheets, correspondence, invoices, and reimbursement forms submitted by conference participants. Highlights include the Final report to the Ford Foundation, which provides a historical context and rationale for the conference. Box 2 containing Series II and part of Series III were returned to RISM March 2009.

 Series III. Conference Papers: Research and Resources of Haiti, 1967 - 1973, undated Scope and Contents note

1.5 linear feet (3 boxes), arranged chronologically. The papers in this series document the activities and participants associated with the November 1967 conference and have been organized as three subseries. Subseries A includes pre-conference organizing, agendas and programs, administrative details, mailing lists, expense reports and summarized proceedings, which are also included in the CHS Committee Papers (Series IV). Subseries B consists of conference participant files, which have been retained in original alphabetical order by last name. These files include correspondence, curriculum vitae, articles, and manuscripts. Subseries C consists of reel-to-reel audiotapes. Box 4 containing part of Series III Subseries B. Conference Participants was returned to the Reed Foundation in March 2009.

 General note

Some of the materials in Series III are at the Reed Foundation.

 Subseries B. Conference Participants General note

Some of the materials in Subseries B are the Reed Foundation.

CHS Committee Papers, 1967 - 1975, undated Scope and Contents note

.75 linear feet (1 box, 4 folders), arranged chronologically. This bilingual series retraces the transition and development of CHS. The papers include correspondence, draft reports, draft and final versions of committee statutes, summarized proceedings of the November 1967 conference, meeting agendas, minutes, mailing lists, expense records, reimbursement forms, notes, and ephemera.

 Correspondence 7 1 1967 December Draft reports, amendments 7 2 1968 January Correspondence, manuscript 7 3 1968 January Correspondence 7 4 1968 January-May Correspondence, notes 7 5 1968 February-December Correspondence, resume of Haitian Conference [French, bound copy], list of participants 7 6 1968 March Resume of Haitian Conference [French, bound copy] 7 7 1968 March Summary of conference proceedings [English, bound copy] 7 8 [1968 March] Correspondence, CHS statutes 7 9 1968 March-April Correspondence [French], list of attendees, meeting agendas, detailed expenses, invoices, ephemera 7 10 1968 May-June Correspondence, mailing documents correspondence, news release, CHS statutes, amendement, Resume [French and English], notes 7 11 1968 June-August Meeting agenda, list of expenses, correspondence, ephemera 7 12 1968 November Notes 7 13 1968 December Correspondence, notes 7 14 1969 January-November Notes, manuscript 7 15 1969 March, 1969 Correspondence, meeting agendas, minutes, sample newsletters, expense forms, mailing list, notes, ephemera 7 16 1969 May-June, undated Mailing lists, correspondence, minutes, list of expenses, notes, ephemera 7 17 1969 August-September, undated Correspondence, invitations, notes, list of expenses, ephemera 7 18 1969 May-June Correspondence, notes, list of expenses, ephemera 8 1 1969 December Correspondence, mailing lists 8 2 1970 February-March CHS Bulletin No. 1, notes, miscellaneous papers 8 3 1970 April-May, 1971 February, undated Correspondence 8 4 1970 July, 1972 November, 1975 February Series V. Haiti Seminar Series, 1969 - 1970, undated Scope and Contents note

6 folders, arranged chronologically. This series documents the joint efforts of the Center for Haitian Studies and the Massachusetts Institute of Technology to produce seminars on Haitian issues. The papers include correspondence, mailing lists, invoices, minutes, notes, and ephemera.

 Proposed schedule of seminars, mailing lists, correspondence, notes 8 5 1969 January Correspondence 8 6 1969 February Correspondence, notes 8 7 1969 March Correspondence, form letters, notes, mailing list, invoices, lists of expenses, notes, ephemera 8 8 1969 April , undated Correspondence, participant list, invoices, list of expenses, invitation, notes 8 9 1969 May-June Correspondence 8 10 1970 February-March Series VI. Conference Papers: Culture and Development in Haiti, 1969 - 1974, undated Scope and Contents note

5 folders, arranged chronologically. This series consists of correspondence, brochures, invitations, flyers, programs, manuscripts, draft material and final reports. Highlights include an article concerning the CIA and Haiti, and flyers denouncing the Ford Foundation's funding of the conference.

 Correspondence 8 11 1969 August, 1970 January-March Article on the CIA and Haiti, flyers denouncing the 1970 conference 8 12 1970 May, undated Invitation, conference programs, final reports 8 13 1970 May Conference programs 8 14 1970 May Program information, draft material, manuscripts, correspondence, ephemera 8 15 1970 May, undated Publishing catalog, Sei, journal ayisyin aletrangje, ephemera 8 16 1971, 1974 April, undated Series VII. Clippings, 1967 - 1969, undated Scope and Contents note

5 folders, arranged chronologically. The clippings in this series describe the formation, goals and accomplishments of CHS and the political climate in Haiti. Also included is an obituary of noted Haitian folklorist Dr. Jean Price-Mars.

 Haiti Research Group Planned, Miami Herald 8 17 1967 November Article outlining the goals of the center and its affiliates, note, Trans-cultural Psychiatric Research Vol. 5 8 18 1968 October Center for Advanced International Studies, University of Miami, Journal of Inter-American Studies Vol. X, No. 4 8 19 1968 October Haiti Conference Published, Newsletter of the American Anthropology Association, Vol. 10, No. 10, note 8 20 1969 December, undated Criado Centro de Estudos Haitianos, America Latina, ephemera 8 21 undated Obituary for Jean Price-Mars, published in Jeune Afrique and Le Nouvelliste 8 22 Mar 1969 Editorial concerning the regime of Francois Duvalier, The Jamaican Daily Gleaner 8 23 1969 July Report to O.A.S. Describes Charges of Terror in Haiti, N.Y. Times 8 24 1969 August [?] Series VIII. Publication Papers, 1967 - 1976 Scope and Contents note

.5 linear feet (1 box), arranged chronologically. The papers in this series reflect the efforts of CHS members to publish Research and Resources of Haiti, the November 1967 conference proceedings. A limited run of the book was published by RISM in 1969. As a result of high demand, a second version was published by Teachers College in 1975. The papers include correspondence, price quotations, invoices, dedication page and table of contents, sample cover, application and certification of copyright, mailing lists, requests for publication copies, and book reviews.

Oversized Documents, 1969 - 1970 Scope and Contents note

2 folders, arranged chronologically. This series includes all oversized items in the collection.
